needs.title: Automated Bluesky Posting
needs.description: Integrate Bluesky posting into the CMS with API-driven publishing.
needs.useCase: Heraclitus has no way to publish to Bluesky. Script exists at scripts/bluesky-post.js but no CMS integration. Need API-driven posting.
acceptanceCriteria: CMS can publish posts to Bluesky via API
Posting queue supports Bluesky as a platform
Success/failure status visible in CMS

comments.author: claude
comments.text: Implemented: @atproto/api integration with lazy-auth BskyAgent, POST /api/posting-queue/:id/publish endpoint, GET /api/bluesky/status health check, and full UI support in ManualPostingQueue.jsx with publish button, status feedback, and connection indicator.

needs.title: Content Repurposing Engine
needs.description: Automatically adapt one idea into platform-specific posts for Twitter, Bluesky, Instagram, Reddit, and Medium.
needs.useCase: One idea should become 5 platform-adapted posts (Twitter thread, Bluesky post, Instagram card, Reddit comment, Medium paragraph). Currently manual per-platform rewriting.
acceptanceCriteria: Given one idea, generates drafts for 5 platforms
Each draft respects platform character limits and conventions
Agent voice is preserved per-platform

needs.title: Content Calendar View
needs.description: Interactive visual calendar showing scheduled content across all platforms.
needs.useCase: POSTING_SCHEDULE.md exists but no interactive calendar. Need visual week/month view of what's scheduled where.
acceptanceCriteria: Week and month views showing scheduled posts
Color-coded by platform and agent
Click to view/edit scheduled content
Drag to reschedule

needs.title: Follower Growth Tracker
needs.description: Track daily follower counts across Twitter, Bluesky, and Reddit with progress toward milestones.
needs.useCase: Currently follower counts noted manually in outreach JSONs. Need daily snapshots across Twitter, Bluesky, Reddit to track progress toward 1000-follower Gumroad unlock.
acceptanceCriteria: Daily automated snapshot of follower counts per platform
CMS dashboard widget showing progress toward 1000 followers
Historical chart of follower growth over time

comments.text: Completed via Analytics Dashboard. Platform metrics PATCH auto-snapshots daily history (365-day cap). Growth chart with 7d/30d/90d/All toggle. Progress goals track milestones like 1000 subscribers. See /analytics.
Added daily automated Twitter snapshot via Bird CLI cron at 6 AM PST. Pulls followers, following, and tweet count automatically. All 3 acceptance criteria now fully met.

needs.title: Reply & Mention Monitor
needs.description: Monitor incoming replies and mentions across platforms with CMS alerts.
needs.useCase: No system watches for incoming replies to our outreach comments. Replies from Days 1-4 targets could be missed. Need periodic scanning + CMS alerts.
acceptanceCriteria: Periodic scan for new replies to our tweets/posts
CMS notification for each new reply or mention
Queue for drafting responses to incoming engagement

needs.title: Outreach Effectiveness Dashboard
needs.description: Aggregate analytics showing which outreach strategies generate the most engagement.
needs.useCase: 20 users targeted across 4 days. No aggregate view of which user types, themes, or times of day generate engagement. Need follow-back rate, reply rate, engagement patterns.
acceptanceCriteria: Dashboard showing follow-back rate, reply rate by target type
Time-of-day and day-of-week engagement heatmap
Top-performing outreach themes identified

needs.title: Audience Segmentation
needs.description: Understand and categorize who engages with our content by topic interest and behavior.
needs.useCase: No understanding of who's engaging. Which topics resonate with which audience segments? Needed for targeted content strategy.
acceptanceCriteria: Audience segments defined by engagement patterns
Content recommendations per segment
Segment growth tracking over time

needs.title: Weekly Performance Report
needs.description: Automated weekly rollup of all key metrics, generated every Monday.
needs.useCase: No automated weekly rollup. Need: posts published, engagement totals, follower delta, top-performing content, agent productivity, cost summary. Auto-generated every Monday.
acceptanceCriteria: Auto-generated report every Monday morning
Includes: posts published, engagement totals, follower delta
Top-performing content and agent productivity summary
Cost summary with week-over-week comparison

needs.title: Engagement Trend Charts
needs.description: Time-series visualizations of engagement growth by platform over weeks and months.
needs.useCase: engagement-data.json exists but Analytics view is basic. Need time-series charts showing engagement growth by platform over weeks/months.
acceptanceCriteria: Line charts showing engagement over time per platform
Selectable date ranges (week, month, quarter)
Overlay comparison between platforms

needs.title: Bird CLI Write Access Fix
needs.description: Resolve Twitter error 226 blocking all automated posting via Bird CLI.
needs.useCase: Twitter error 226 blocks all automated posting. Need strategy to resolve (token refresh, new auth, alternative API). This is the #1 blocker for Nietzsche's autonomous operation.
acceptanceCriteria: Bird CLI can successfully post tweets
Error 226 resolved or alternative posting method found
Automated posting pipeline functional end-to-end

needs.title: WebSocket Real-Time Updates
needs.description: Replace 30s polling with WebSocket connections for instant CMS updates.
needs.useCase: CMS uses 30s polling. WebSocket would make dashboard, notifications, and task updates instant. Phase 2 infrastructure.
acceptanceCriteria: WebSocket server running alongside Express
Dashboard, notifications, and task views update in real-time
Graceful fallback to polling if WebSocket disconnects

needs.title: Agent Communication Protocol
needs.description: Structured inter-agent messaging system with CMS visibility.
needs.useCase: No formal inter-agent messaging. Hypatia blocked a Diogenes draft but communication was through file notes. Need structured alerts agent-to-agent with CMS visibility.
acceptanceCriteria: Agent-to-agent message sending via API
Messages visible in CMS with sender/recipient
Notification triggers for urgent inter-agent alerts

needs.title: Website Deployment to Netlify
needs.description: Deploy the Hugo site to Netlify for public web presence.
needs.useCase: Hugo site built, GitHub repo exists, FINISH_DEPLOYMENT.md has steps. Just needs execution. Unlocks public web presence.
acceptanceCriteria: Hugo site deployed to Netlify
Custom domain configured
Auto-deploy from GitHub pushes working

needs.title: Gumroad Product Pipeline
needs.description: Tooling and templates ready for product launch when follower milestone is reached.
needs.useCase: Task-012 blocked until 1000 followers. Need tooling ready for when it unblocks: product page templates, pricing strategy, launch announcement drafts, CMS integration for tracking sales.
acceptanceCriteria: Product page templates ready
Pricing strategy documented
Launch announcement drafts prepared
CMS integration for tracking Gumroad sales

needs.title: Patreon Integration
needs.description: API integration for subscriber tracking, content gating, and tier management.
needs.useCase: Marcus manages Patreon manually. API integration would enable subscriber tracking, content gating, tier management from within CMS.
acceptanceCriteria: Patreon API connected to CMS
Subscriber count and tier breakdown visible
Content gating rules manageable from CMS

needs.title: Writing Style Guide Enforcement
needs.description: Automated consistency checking against agent SOUL.md voice definitions.
needs.useCase: Each agent has voice defined in SOUL.md but no automated consistency checking. Need a review step that catches off-brand content before it ships.
acceptanceCriteria: Automated voice consistency check on draft content
Flags content that deviates from agent's SOUL.md voice
Review step in publishing pipeline before content ships

needs.title: Auto-Approval Thresholds
needs.description: Define rules for low-risk content that can ship without manual Shawn approval.
needs.useCase: Shawn is single approval bottleneck for all public content. Define thresholds where low-risk content (reposts, standard replies) can ship without manual approval.
acceptanceCriteria: Risk levels defined for content types (repost, reply, original)
Low-risk content auto-approved with audit log
High-risk content still requires manual approval
Override mechanism for Shawn to adjust thresholds

needs.title: Reply Queue for Outreach
needs.description: CMS queue for drafting and publishing replies to target posts on Bluesky and Twitter. Bluesky replies auto-publish via API, Twitter uses copy-and-open. Linked tasks auto-complete when replies are posted.
needs.useCase: Outreach system generates reply drafts but they lived in markdown files with no CMS integration. Needed a way for Shawn to review and publish replies with one click, same as the posting queue.
acceptanceCriteria: Reply queue page in CMS with add/edit/delete
Bluesky replies auto-publish via AT Protocol API
Twitter replies use copy-and-open pattern
Rate limiting (5/day, 15min spacing per platform)
Linked task auto-completes when reply is posted
Activity logged in mission-control

needs.title: Audience Segmentation Dashboard
needs.description: Categorize audience by topic interest and behavior, recommend content per segment, and track segment growth over time.
needs.useCase: No understanding of who's engaging with TensionLines. Need to categorize audience by topic interest and behavior patterns to drive targeted content strategy.
acceptanceCriteria: Audience segments defined by engagement patterns and topic interest
Content recommendations per segment via Haiku
Segment growth tracking over time with snapshots

needs.title: Systematic Book Completion Plan
needs.description: Create a structured timeline and writing plan for the 5 TensionLines books.
needs.useCase: 5 books have chapter outlines but no systematic writing plan. No weekly targets, no agent assignments per chapter, no timeline. At current pace books are 12-24 months out.
acceptanceCriteria: Book 1 (Philosophy) prioritized with 6-month completion timeline
Chapters assigned to philosopher agents with weekly word count targets
Progress tracked in CMS dashboard
Weekly milestones defined (500-1000 words per chapter)

needs.title: Newsletter Automation System
needs.description: Weekly philosophy digest auto-generated from top content and ideas.
needs.useCase: Newsletter infrastructure exists on Substack but no content is being published. Marcus Aurelius is the designated voice but has no automated workflow for generating and sending newsletters.
acceptanceCriteria: Weekly digest template designed
Auto-pulls from top ideas and published content
Substack integration for send
Signup CTAs added to social profiles

needs.title: Systematic Influencer Outreach Program
needs.description: Build and execute a strategic engagement program with philosophy and self-help influencers.
needs.useCase: Growth is organic but slow. Targeted engagement with 100 influencers across Twitter and Bluesky could accelerate audience growth significantly. Some outreach exists but is ad-hoc.
acceptanceCriteria: Target list of 100 philosophy/self-help influencers built
Outreach templates per philosopher voice
Response rate and conversion tracking
Collaboration opportunities identified

needs.title: Community Management Automation
needs.description: Smart comment filtering, sentiment analysis, and priority routing for engagement.
needs.useCase: Comments and replies exist in queues but lack smart filtering. No way to prioritize questions over praise, detect criticism, or auto-categorize. Manual review of everything wastes time.
acceptanceCriteria: Sentiment analysis on incoming comments
Auto-categorization: questions, praise, criticism, spam
Priority routing for meaningful engagement
Community health metrics dashboard

needs.title: Philosophy Podcast / Audio Content
needs.description: Extend TensionLines into audio with short philosophy reflection episodes.
needs.useCase: Audio reaches audiences who prefer listening over reading — commuters, runners, etc. Lower production barrier than video. Existing ideas bank content can be repurposed as episode scripts.
acceptanceCriteria: 5-10 minute episode format defined
First 5 episodes recorded and published
Distribution to Spotify and Apple Podcasts
Weekly or bi-weekly cadence established

needs.title: Reddit Community Activation
needs.description: Launch TensionLines presence on Reddit via Diogenes. Reddit has philosophy-hungry subreddits (r/philosophy, r/stoicism, r/selfimprovement). Diogenes has a drafted welcome post ready. Easiest win on the roadmap.
needs.useCase: Zero Reddit presence despite having content and a designated agent.
acceptanceCriteria: Reddit welcome post published
Recurring weekly engagement
Diogenes has Reddit templates

needs.title: Automatic Idea-to-Draft Pipeline
needs.description: Auto-adapt ideas from the bank into platform-specific drafts routed through philosopher voices. Highest-ROI automation — expected 3-5x content velocity, saves 5-10 hrs/week.
needs.useCase: Ideas sit in bank and drafts are created manually. Repurposing engine exists but is not automated.
acceptanceCriteria: Auto-adapt ideas to 5 platform formats
Route to correct philosopher voice
Queue drafts for human review
Save 5-10 hrs/week

needs.title: Advanced Analytics Dashboard
needs.description: Real analytics with growth charts, content performance rankings, and platform comparison. Enables data-driven decisions on where to invest effort.
needs.useCase: Current analytics are basic metric displays. Cannot track trends, identify top content, or compare platform ROI.
acceptanceCriteria: Per-platform growth charts (WoW, MoM)
Content performance rankings
Revenue tracking with targets
Platform comparison view

needs.title: Multi-Platform AI Agent
needs.description: Unified agent monitoring all platforms with cross-platform consistency, auto-response with approval flow, and smart per-platform scheduling.
needs.useCase: Each platform is managed separately. A unified agent could watch all platforms simultaneously and ensure consistent messaging.
acceptanceCriteria: Unified inbox for all notifications
Auto-response with approval flow
Cross-platform content consistency
Smart per-platform scheduling

needs.title: Implement Authentication & Authorization System
needs.description: All 130 API endpoints are currently unprotected. Add JWT-based authentication with role-based access control to prevent unauthorized access to sensitive data, task management, and posting capabilities.
needs.useCase: Security hardening identified by weekly automated review

needs.title: Add Input Validation & Sanitization Middleware
needs.description: Implement comprehensive input validation for all POST/PATCH endpoints to prevent injection attacks, especially for user-generated content in posting queues, comments, and agent messages.
needs.useCase: Security hardening identified by weekly automated review

needs.title: Secure API Keys & Credentials Management
needs.description: Audit and move all platform API keys (Bluesky, Twitter, Instagram, Threads, Anthropic) to encrypted environment variables or secret management system. Implement key rotation procedures.
needs.useCase: Security hardening identified by weekly automated review

needs.title: Implement Backup Encryption & Access Controls
needs.description: Encrypt backup files (currently in mission-control/backups) and restrict restore endpoint access. Add integrity checks and automated backup verification.
needs.useCase: Security hardening identified by weekly automated review

needs.title: Automated Dependency Vulnerability Scanning
needs.description: Integrate npm audit automation and Dependabot alerts into CI/CD pipeline. Current dependencies need regular security updates with 21+ packages requiring monitoring.
needs.useCase: Security hardening identified by weekly automated review

needs.title: Agent Performance Prediction & Task Auto-Assignment
needs.description: Build ML model using existing performance data to predict optimal agent-task matches. Auto-assign incoming tasks based on agent strengths, availability, and historical completion patterns.
needs.useCase: Enhancement identified by weekly automated review

needs.title: Cross-Platform Content Performance Correlation Engine
needs.description: Analyze which content types, philosophers, and topics perform best on each platform. Automatically suggest optimal platform selection for new content based on historical engagement data.
needs.useCase: Enhancement identified by weekly automated review

needs.title: Smart Rate Limiting Per Agent & Platform
needs.description: Replace generic express-rate-limit with intelligent throttling based on platform API limits, agent posting patterns, and cost optimization. Prevent API quota exhaustion and reduce unnecessary API costs.
needs.useCase: Enhancement identified by weekly automated review

needs.title: Implement Role-Based Access Control (RBAC) for API Endpoints
needs.description: 136 endpoints lack authorization checks beyond authentication. Implement RBAC to ensure agents/users can only access endpoints appropriate to their role (e.g., Diogenes shouldn't delete all tasks).
needs.useCase: Security hardening identified by weekly automated review

needs.title: Add CSRF Protection for State-Changing Endpoints
needs.description: POST/PATCH/DELETE endpoints lack CSRF tokens. With WebSocket connections and potential XSS, malicious sites could trigger unauthorized actions.
needs.useCase: Security hardening identified by weekly automated review

needs.title: Implement File Upload Validation & Sandboxing
needs.description: Backup restore and potential content uploads need strict validation (file type, size, path traversal prevention) and isolated execution to prevent arbitrary code execution.
needs.useCase: Security hardening identified by weekly automated review

needs.title: Add SQL/NoSQL Injection Protection Layer
needs.description: Database queries appear to use JSON file storage but lack parameterization. Implement query sanitization to prevent injection through task titles, agent names, or search queries.
needs.useCase: Security hardening identified by weekly automated review

needs.title: Audit & Rotate Anthropic/Bluesky API Keys with Secrets Manager
needs.description: API keys for @anthropic-ai/sdk and @atproto/api likely stored in env files. Implement automated rotation and use a proper secrets manager with audit logging.
needs.useCase: Security hardening identified by weekly automated review

needs.title: Agent Context Window Manager with Memory Pruning
needs.description: Implement intelligent context management to track token usage per agent conversation, prune old context, and maintain relevant memory across long-running tasks.
needs.useCase: Enhancement identified by weekly automated review

needs.title: Batch Processing Queue for Multi-Post Operations
needs.description: Auto-pipeline and repurpose engine lack batch optimization. Add queue system to process multiple posts with rate limiting, retry logic, and progress tracking.
needs.useCase: Enhancement identified by weekly automated review

needs.title: A/B Testing Framework for Content Variations
needs.description: Enable agents to generate multiple versions of posts, track performance metrics, and automatically learn which styles/formats perform best per platform.
needs.useCase: Enhancement identified by weekly automated review

needs.title: Agent Debate Threads (Public)
needs.description: Scheduled weekly debates where two philosopher agents publicly disagree on a tension line. Nietzsche vs Diogenes on Twitter, Plato vs Socrates on Medium. In character, threaded, shareable.
needs.useCase: People screenshot and share debate threads. Two AI philosophers arguing in character about real tensions (freedom vs security, authenticity vs performance) is inherently viral. Creates a recurring content event that followers anticipate and share.
acceptanceCriteria: Weekly cron picks a tension line topic and two opposing agents
Each agent writes 2-3 posts arguing their side in voice
Output goes to posting queue as a thread/series
Debate topics sourced from book outline tension lines

needs.title: Reader-Submitted Tension Lines
needs.description: Let followers submit their own contradictions for the agents to analyze. Socrates questions them, Marcus gives stoic advice, Diogenes calls BS. Creates engagement loops and makes followers feel seen.
needs.useCase: Audience participation is the #1 growth lever on social. Submitting personal tension lines creates emotional investment. Agent responses in character create shareworthy content. Could be a Telegram bot, web form, or just Twitter replies.
acceptanceCriteria: Submission form or bot accepts 'My tension: X vs Y' input
2-3 agents respond in character with different perspectives
Responses queued for posting with original submission as context
Best submissions curated into weekly highlight thread

needs.title: Book Writing as Public Content
needs.description: Share the book pipeline process publicly. Weekly updates on what Plato drafted, what Socrates questioned, what Hypatia fact-checked. The meta-narrative of AI philosophers collaborating on a book is arguably more interesting than the book itself.
needs.useCase: The book pipeline already generates 4 agents collaborating per section. Packaging that process as social content is zero-cost repurposing. 'This week Plato wrestled with Ecclesiastes. Socrates had questions.' People love watching creative process.
acceptanceCriteria: After each book pipeline run, auto-generate social summary post
Include snippet of Socrates questions or Hypatia fact-checks
Post to Twitter/Bluesky as 'behind the scenes' content
Link to full chapter on website when published

needs.title: Weekly Tension Report Newsletter (Substack)
needs.description: Curated weekly email summarizing what the agents discussed, debated, and wrote. Social is discovery, email is the relationship. Converts scrollers into committed readers.
needs.useCase: Substack is already in the platform list but no content flows there. A weekly digest curated by Tension herself — pulling from debates, book progress, best posts, and reader submissions — builds the deepest audience relationship.
acceptanceCriteria: Weekly cron generates newsletter draft from week's activity
Includes: top post, book update, debate highlight, reader spotlight
Tension's voice as curator/editor
Substack API integration for publishing

needs.title: Tension Line Framework as Paid Product
needs.description: Package the book's core framework (identify your tensions, navigate without collapsing) into a paid digital product. Workshop PDF, web tool, or guided exercise where people map their own tension lines with agent-generated analysis.
needs.useCase: The book framework is inherently a coaching/self-assessment tool. A Gumroad PDF or interactive web tool where users identify their tension lines and get personalized agent analysis could be the first revenue product. Low effort, high perceived value.
acceptanceCriteria: Tension Line Mapping exercise designed (5-10 prompts)
Agent-generated personalized analysis per submission
Gumroad product page with preview
Launch announcement drafted for all platforms

needs.title: Agent Reaction Posts (News/Culture Commentary)
needs.description: When something happens in news or culture, 2-3 agents react differently to the same event in character. Nietzsche provokes, Marcus counsels restraint, Diogenes mocks. Recurring format that rides trending topics.
needs.useCase: Trending topics are the fastest growth lever on social. Having 3 distinct philosophical takes on the same event is unique and shareable. 'What would Diogenes say about [trending thing]?' is a recurring content format with built-in audience curiosity.
acceptanceCriteria: Manual trigger: input a topic, get 3 agent reactions
Each reaction in the agent's authentic voice from SOUL.md
Output to posting queue as coordinated multi-agent series
Optional: auto-detect trending topics via Twitter API
